result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy James Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Jeremy James
defendant.address: 241 S Main St, Oconto Falls, WI 54154

records.addlTxt: from Deft. to Judge Judge re:  completion of class

10:32 AM Defendant Jeremy James Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jeremy James Johnson.  Attorney Amy Pautzke in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defense filed PLQ and Plea Agreement.  Court reviews charge and Deft. enters a NO CONTEST Plea to Count 1.   Plea quest. & waiver of rights reviewed.  Voting/Firearms.  Court finds plea made freely & voluntarily and accepts plea and Deft. is adjudged guilty and orders a JOC entered into the record.  PSI Ordered.  Count 2 is dismissed.  Present bond cont'd.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy James Johnson in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jeremy James Johnson.  Still in negotiations.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
11:36  Information to be filed and mirrors complaint.  Defense stands mute.  Court enters NOT GUILTY Plea.

11:29 AM   Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jeremy James Johnson.  Defendant Jeremy James Johnson not in court.  BW AUTH.   Resume 11:34 Deft. appeared.  PQW received/reviewed by Court. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.
